text: here’s what we have dev’d for the cubby animation outside of the template engine
using bodymovin for the circle to plane animation and velocityjs for the rest of the animations

2) bodymovin means we need ot use velocity.js or no?
bodymovin doesnt need velocityjs, just the bodymovin.js player
roger that
link should work for anyone on UNCORKED
i dont believe the template engine currently has velocityjs baked into the UI
we’d need to decided if we want to incorporate velocityjs or keep it limited to bodymovin/css3
would we want both velocity and bodymovin/css3?
its my understanding that you cant get the welcome and retrospective to do simultaneous transforms in bodymovin/css3, accurate?
bodymovin will handle transforms simultaneously (essentially like a movie), just not sure how performant it is for large timelines with many shapes involved
css3 keyframes has the limitations with simultaneous transforms
bodymovin restricts us with editing animations without reexporting the data from AE
velocityJS gives us more control over individual elements in the code but may be a little more time consuming
yeah right now I havnt included velocity yet. would need to evaluate that
found out the feed im pulling for trends actually does appear to be from the trends site, its the api they used to populate their map view <https://www.youtube.com/trendsmap>

<@U02E3CRMA>: As requested here is a brief overview of installation for the headnode
0. Install SSD into right most tray.
1. Download/Install Windows 10 64bit using download tool and putting it onto a thumbdrive :<https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windows10/>
2. Download/Install Drivers for Windows 10 from: <http://www.supermicro.com/products/motherboard/Xeon/C600/X10SRA-F.cfm> 
3. Download/Install Nvidia Drivers: <http://www.nvidia.com/content/DriverDownload-March2009/confirmation.php?url=/Windows/Quadro_Certified/362.56/362.56-quadro-grid-desktop-notebook-win10-64bit-international-whql.exe&lang=us&type=Quadro>
4. Download/Install Displax Software <https://support.displax.com/pages/ultrafitwindows>
5. Download/Install Virtualbox <https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads>
6. Move ubuntu image over to the new headnode (Peter should know how to do this.)
I've migrated a few Linux images in my time. I should be good for the last step. :)
Thanks for the instructions... Big help!
